DataElement.definition: The result of an evaluation to determine whether pathologic and/or clinical changes resulted from treatment.

DataElementConcept.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The molecular/pathological and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes:
10/9/24 Upd OC from C50995 to C2991; Upd property from C25217 to C50995 + C25217 to align w new CRDC CDE for Best Overall Response CDE from RFC 69. mr; 
4/16/23 Created for the PCDC-C3DC Aggregated Dictionary data elements. jk

ObjectClass.definition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
The molecular/pathological and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._The result of an action.
ValueDomain.administrativeNotes:
10/28/24 Aligned PV list w CRDC RFC 69 values by deleting some and adding others. mr; 
4/19/23 Created per PCDC metadata template. mr

ValueMeaning.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 4/2/24 Added alt vm for ticket number CADSR0003584 cjl.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.definition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:
2023.5.17 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002435. ak 
2023.3.15 Per LS at COG Protocol defined progressive disease (should have been added as a VM Alt Name for PV 3284666). ak

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.definition: Diagnostic tests fail to detect presence of disease.

Concepts.definition: Diagnostic tests fail to detect presence of disease.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:

10/10/23 changed Long Name from "Not Stated" to match NCIt Preferred name and current caDSR concept Long Name of "Not Reported" per Brenda.Janice . LS

ValueMeaning.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 3/4/25 Added alt VM names per RFC 26 CR 1. sl

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.definition: A disease that does not go to remission despite treatment.

Concepts.definition: A disease that does not go to remission despite treatment.

ValueMeaning.definition: No apparent change or worsening in tumor staging classification.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 4/2/24 Added alt vm for ticket number CADSR0003584 cjl.

Concepts.definition: No apparent change or worsening in lesion staging classification.

ValueMeaning.definition: Complete disappearance of all clinical evidence of disease with skin, nodes, blood and viscera categories having complete response or noninvolvement.

Concepts.definition: Complete disappearance of all clinical evidence of disease with skin, nodes, blood and viscera categories having complete response or noninvolvement.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The molecular/pathological and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: PCDC (Pediatric Cancer Data Commons Aggregated Dictionary)

ReferenceDocuments.documentText: To use Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors, there must be at least one tumor that can be measured on x-rays, CT scans, or MRI scans. The types of response a patient can have are a complete response (CR), a partial response (PR), progressive disease (PD), and stable disease (SD). Also called RECIST. (Source: NCI Dictionary of Cancer Terms)
